summary: There is a very bright section of chrome stripping on the dashboard, just below the control panel, that reflects light which looks like a lightening bolt directly across the windshield in the drivers viewing area.  This happens when both sunlight and street lamps shine on the dashboard.  It is very distracting and dangerous.  Quite bright here in FL. It hasn't caused an accident "yet".  The incidents are continuous, not a specific date.

Genesis 2021 GV 80  2.5 4 cylinder. Engine light on for the 3rd time. previous fixes did not fix the problem. Reported it to the corporate office. Still waiting after one week to have some one contact. No resolution to the problem yet.

The contact owns a 2021 Genesis GV80. The contact stated that while stopped at a turning lane, the engine warning light was illuminated. The engine control system warning message had appeared on the display screen. The contact also received an email from the manufacturer that a possible condition had been detected within the engine control system and a full check was needed whenever convenient with a preferred dealer. The dealer was made aware of the failure on numerous occasions but had not called the contact back. The vehicle was not diagnosed nor repaired. The manufacturer was made aware of the failure and referred the contact to take the vehicle to a dealer for diagnosis. The failure mileage was approximately 1,900.

The contact owns a 2021 Genesis GV80. The contact stated while driving 35 mph, the check engine warning light illuminated. The vehicle was taken to the dealer where it was diagnosed however, the mechanic was unable to duplicate the failure. The technician disengaged the check engine warning light senor however, the failure recurred three times. The manufacturer was not notified of the failure. The failure mileage was approximate 300

Genesis GV80 2.5 T standard option Forward collision warning software problem. These vehicles are sold with this option but not showing on settings, therefore it is not usable. Similar complaints are known with 21 model G80, GV80, G90. I believe this problem is recorded as T17G.

UNDER 30 DAYS OF PURCHASE AND UNDER 1000 MILES - CHECK ENGINE LIGHT KEPT COMING ON-A POSSIBLE CONDITION WITH YOUR ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM. TWO TRIPS TO SERVICE DEPARTMENT, PART IS ON BACK ORDER UNTIL JUNE. SERVICE DEPT HAS VEHICLE FOR LONGER THAN I HAVE OWN THE CAR.

PURCHASED BRAND NEW AND WITHIN 1,000 MILES THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT ILLUMINATED WHILE DRIVING.  TOOK TO DEALER AND THEY DETERMINED IT WAS DUE TO DEFECTIVE FUEL INJECTOR SYSTEM.  BACKORDER ON PARTS, SO THE CARE HAS BEEN IN THE SHOP FOR AS LONG AS WE HAVE OWNED IT.  WONDER IF SIMILAR ISSUE TO THAT WHICH LED TO RECALL OF THE 2021 G70?

WHILE DRIVING A LOW PRESSURE WARNING POPPED UP ON THE DASH.  WHEN I GOT OUT I NOTICED THE REAR DRIVER SIDE TIRE WAS LOW.  I DID A VISUAL INSPECTION OF THE TIRE AND I NOTICED NO DAMAGE.  WHILE ADDING AIR I NOTICED THE PRESSURE WOULD NOT GO OVER 33PSI AND I COULD HEAR AIR ESCAPING THE TIRE.  THERE WAS A BULGE AT THE BEAD OF THE TIRE. THE TIRE WAS COMING OFF THE RIM. WHILE DRIVING THE DAY PRIOR I NOTICED THE VEHICLE WAS UNSTABLE. I BROUGHT THIS VEHICLE IN COUPLE OF TIMES FOR BALANCING ISSUES.

VEHICLE OCCASIONALLY BECAME UNSTABLE AND UNPREDICTABLE WHENEVER IT COMES IN CONTACT WITH OBJECTS/ BUMPS IN THE ROAD. RATTLING FROM LEFT SIDE SUSPENSION UPON RESTARTING DURING IDLE AND GO. ALSO HAVE A BALANCING ISSUE AT HIGHWAY SPEED THAT CAN BE FELT THROUGHOUT THE VEHICLE.
